headline.main: THE RELIGIOUS WORLD.; METHODIST GENERAL CONFERENCE. THE DEBATE ON SLAVERY CONTINUED SPEECHES OF REV. R.M. HATFIELD, REV. S.Y. MONROE, REV. G. BATTELLE, REV. H.M. SHAFFER AND OTHERS THE NEW GENERAL RULE REJECTED YKAS 138, NAYS 74. TWENTY-FOURTH DAY.

docs.lead_paragraph: We have had a good deal of "talk" and some "older" to-day. Rev. R.M. HATFIELD, of the NewYork East Conference, made a well-defined and emphatic avowal of the principles of the Progressive party to-day. He is an orator of acknowledged ability, and spoke to-day with a warmth and show of faith that evinced an intimate acquaintance with the subject he was discussing, and a thorough conviction that he had the right of it.

docs.snippet: We have received a great number of communications from various parts of the country, concerning the action of Mr. GREELEY, as delegate from Oregon, at the Chicago Convention. We must decline their publication, partly because they can serve no useful...
docs.lead_paragraph: We have received a great number of communications from various parts of the country, concerning the action of Mr. GREELEY, as delegate from Oregon, at the Chicago Convention. We must decline their publication, partly because they can serve no useful public purpose, and partly because they involve a personal controversy, for which we have no taste.

headline.main: CITY GOVERNMENT.; QUARANTINE MATTERS. REPLY OF MAYOR WOOD TO THE QUARANTINE COMMISSIONERS. COMMISSIONERS OF EMIGRATION. RESIGNATION OF MR. JOHN A. KENNEDY THE WEEKLY STATISTICS.

docs.lead_paragraph: In consequence of the failure of the Legislature to make an appropriation for the maintenance of Quarantine at this Port, the Commissioners of Quarantine recently applied to the Mayors of this City and Brooklyn for appropriations in support of the Floating Hospital, now at anchor in the lower Bay. The following is mayor WOOD'S reply:

docs.snippet: The United States Mail steamer Quaker City, Capt. R. W. SHUFELDT, from Havana, Friday, 25th, P. M., arrived at this port at 2 o'clock yesterday, having made the passage in 4 days.

headline.main: From Havana.; LARGE FIRES ON THE ISLAND--MOVEMENTS OF THE PIANIST GOTTSCHALK--STATE OF THE SUGAR MARKET.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States Mail steamer Quaker City, Capt. R. W. SHUFELDT, from Havana, Friday, 25th, P. M., arrived at this port at 2 o'clock yesterday, having made the passage in 4 days.

headline.main: POLITICAL MOVEMENTS.; THE HOUSTON MASS MEETING. Large Gathering of the People in Union-Square--Washington statue Illuminated. The Hero of San Jacinto Nominated for the Presidency. Speeches, Address, Resolutions, Music, Fireworks, Guns, and Fun.

docs.lead_paragraph: In response to numerous advertisements, a gathering of several thousand citizens took place in the vicinity of the Washington equestrian statue, as Union-so care, last evening, to hear the claims of Gen. SAM HOUSTON advocated, for the Presidency. A platform was erected near the statue, having the following inscriptions displayed:

headline.main: GREAT BRITAIN.; THE CHAMPIONSHIP. TWO BELTS TO BE AWARDED TO THE TWO COMBATANTS THE OLD BELT LAID UP IN ORDINARY SAYERS RETIRES FROM THE PRIZE RING. GENERAL ENGLISH NEWS.
